fields.description:
Now if i have dependency between projects it is ALWAYS trigger the build. Sometime it isn't necessary. For example if I need to build only if some changes in repository, but preserve dependency tree.

For example

a -> b -> c -> d

 

I need always build 'd' if any changes in parent projects, Parent projects only if have changes.

If I set the 'right' dependencies 'b' and 'c' build alwayse if some changes in 'a' - *wrong*.

if I break make direct dependencies to 'd' from parents and remove inter dependencies it sometime works but may build in wrong order e.g. 'c' before 'b' (if both have changes in repo).

So I NEED to have full dependency tree, but for 'a', 'b' and 'c' trigger the build only if repository have changes
fields.summary: Allows to switch off dependency trigger

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a CodeDeploy Task in Bamboo 5.14.1, the "Applications" call fails with a {{java.lang.LinkageError}}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an AWS CodeDeploy deploy task

h3. Expected Results

The Applications drop down menu is populated by the REST call, and you are able to save the Task with an Application to deploy
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}2016-11-13 02:51:58,913 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-33] [ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: loader constraint violation: loader (instance of org/apache/felix/framework/BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoaderJava5) previously initiated loading for a different type with name "com/fasterxml/jackson/core/JsonToken"
java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation: loader (instance of org/apache/felix/framework/BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoaderJava5) previously initiated loading for a different type with name "com/fasterxml/jackson/core/JsonToken"{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Download both plugins attached to this ticked and install them via 'Manage add-ons > Upload add-on'
fields.summary: java.lang.LinkageError on AWS CodeDeploy task

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Install a Bamboo instance
 # Connect it to Bitbucket through an application link
 # Stop the Bamboo instance
 # Install another Bamboo instance with the exact same Base URL used in step 1
 # Connect it to Bitbucket through an application link (you will be able to create the application link since the server ID is different)
 # Create a linked repository to a repository in Bitbucket
 # Create a plan and associate it to a Bitbucket repository linked
 # Configure the automatic plan branch creation for this plan
 # In Bitbucket, create a branch in the repository linked

h4. Expected results:

One plan branch is created in Bamboo
h4. Actual results:

Two plan branches are created in Bamboo
fields.summary: Bamboo is creating duplicated plan branches when a branch is created in Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If existing build is triggered from JIRA version "Build and Release" function, bamboo.jira.version variable isn't added into the build

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Application Link between JIRA and Bamboo
# Create JIRA Software Development Project
# Create a JIRA version
# Create a Bamboo Plan with two stages
# Set the second stage to be manual
# Run the Bamboo Plan but do not initiate the second stage
# Click on "Build and Release" on the JIRA version
# Select Release "with existing build"
# Choose the second stage on Step 6

h3. Expected Results
After the build runs, it will have bamboo.jira.version variable

h3. Actual Results
bamboo.jira.version variable is missing
fields.summary: bamboo.jira.version missing when existing build is triggered by JIRA

fields.description:
Sometimes it is useful to have state information shared from run to run of a plan.  For example, you may want to take action only when a test goes from passed to failed or failed to passed.

Currently Bamboo will always look for an artifact for the most recent build. If you try to download an artifact for the plan that's currently running, then Bamboo will look for an artifact created during the current run of the plan so its impossible to get the artifact from the previous run.

It would be great if the current Artifact system could be expanded to support this use case.

 

Thanks,

Phil
fields.summary: Allow artifacts to persist between runs of the same plan

fields.description:
It is possible to get the variable context for the plan from the following REST:
*<Bamboo_URL>/rest/api/latest/plan/<PLAN>?expand=variableContext*

This returns the variables as they are configured right at the moment we call the REST, since this is the plan configuration.

Unfortunately there is no way to get the variable from a specific build:
*<Bamboo_URL>/rest/api/latest/result/<BUILD-KEY>?expand=x.x.variableContext*
fields.summary: Add REST API endpoint to get variable context for each build result
Display duration for each task in the finish log message

fields.description:
Plan branches are great for allowing users to run builds and tests on their feature branches.  Currently the plan branches inherit their permissions from the parent plan.  This means that in order to have permission to build their feature branch, users must also have permission to build the parent branch.

In our workflow the parent branch is the integration branch and building it also kicks off our release process.  Normally this is triggered automatically when a feature branch is merged in or manually by the Bamboo admin if something goes wrong.  We would like to prevent users from accidentally building it and triggering a release by restricting the build permissions to the Bamboo Admin.

Ideally we would have a separate set of permissions on the Branches tab that all plan branches would use.  These would be independent of the permissions for the parent plan set on the Permissions tab.

 

Thanks,

Phil
fields.summary: Allow different permissions for plan branches and the parent plan

fields.description: Please, update [Restoring passwords to recover admin users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Restoring+passwords+to+recover+admin+users] to include reference to [Bamboo lost connection to the external user directory preventing users from logging in|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamkb/bamboo-lost-connection-to-the-external-user-directory-preventing-users-from-logging-in-678691207.html]. The latter shows how to change Bamboo user authentication to use its internal user directory and how to run queries to clear data from "auth_attempt_info" and "rememberme_token", these actions also can help to recover Bamboo admin user access.
fields.summary: Update document - "Restoring passwords to recover admin users"

fields.description:
As a manager I want to choose which deployment projects I see so I can quickly tell the current snapshot of what version of code is in each environment of my different deployment projects.

 

It would be preferable for it be displayable in a Bamboo Dashboard and JIRA dashboard

Other spots that would work would be as a Confluence macro or All Deployment Project favorite. 

 

Dashboard method:

Have a selector for Source build plan and environment and then show the Release field & completed date.

I want to recreate the example below from Confluence in a general table
 * I display 4 environments as text
 * release field as link (select source build plan, environment)  
 * change icon (display icon if build was completed within designated interval)

!image-2016-11-04-17-39-28-981.png|width=505,height=226!

!image-2016-11-04-17-46-23-154.png|width=489,height=269!

 

Or Add a favorite button and filter on All Deployment Projects.. this would be the lease favorite method but would be an improvement. 

!image-2016-11-04-17-37-49-336.png|width=511,height=329!
fields.summary: Deployment Environment view for dashboard or confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a build containing several new commits fails, and then later on another build is performed containing additional commits, the "Commits" tab will only show the subset of commits since the last failed build. In some workflows this can be an issue, as we may want to see everything new the build contains since the last successful build.

For example, if generating a new release from build results we would want to see everything the new release "contains" - which is not possible if the commits tab only show minor commits about fixing a build failure, and not all the changes the previous build was intended to include.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to list all commits since the last successful build, or change the behaviour so that Bamboo lists all commits since the last successful build by default
fields.summary: Build result Commits tab should show all changes since last successful build

fields.description: Some customers want to be able to create and edit deployment environments outside of Bamboo. It would be great if we could provide additional endpoints to create and edit deploy environments using the API.
fields.summary: Rest API for editing and creating deploy environment

fields.description:
h4. Context:

In Bamboo, non-admin users can list local and remote-agents (Build activity > online agents), but only can view the "Agents summary" for local agents.
h4. Problem:

Some times developers need to know the capabilities of remote agents to create plans, but they are not allowed to view it.
h4. Solution:

Allow non-admin users to view the "Agents summary" (Capabilities, Executable deployment environments, Executable jobs and Recent builds) of online remote-agents.
fields.summary: Non-admin users can't view "Agents summary" for online remote-agents.

fields.description:
The bamboo_shortPlanName environment variable contains the plan name when building the default branch, but contains the branch name for branch builds.  I consider this a defect, not a improvement. But your JIRA configuration wouldn't allow be to create a "bug" and told me to raise a support ticket, and your support staff told me to file an enhancement request.

While the bamboo_buildPlanName and bamboo_planName contain the plan name, it can not be extracted with 100% reliably because the character sequence " - " used to delimit project and plan names are valid in project and plan names themselves.

I filed BAM-17988 to request a new environment variable for the project name, but to be truly useful we also need a plan name environment variable that contains the plan name (it makes no sense to me why bamboo_shortPlanName does not).

In general, I find it more separate values more useful than composite or derived values. It's usually easy to paste two or more variables together; it's often much harder (or impossible) to extract individual values from a composite.  For example, I averaged 60 miles/hour on my commute this morning – how long did I take to get to work?

Ideally there wouldn't be variables like bamboo_buildPlanName or bamboo_planName at all, as users that need a string with project name + plan name + branch name + job name could construct it out of component parts (Of course, now that these exists they can't be removed, I'm just using this an example of the principle).
fields.summary: bamboo_shortPlanName environment variable doesn't actually contain plan name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using _Bitbucket Server repository triggered_ trigger, the plan polls for changes every 3 minutes. This causes the plan to be triggered by changes of other repository in the plan.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create application link to Bitbucket Server
 # Create a linked repo to Bitbucket Server
 # Create a linked repo to another repository other than Bitbucker Server (Bitbucket Cloud, SVN or Git)
 # Create a plan with the Bitbucket Server repository and add the non bitbucket server repository to the plan
 # Ensure that the only trigger used is _Bitbucket Server repository triggered_
 # Make a commit to the non Bitbucket Server repository
 # Wait 3 minutes

h3. Expected Results

The build should not be triggered as it should only be triggered by the Bitbucket Server repository
h3. Actual Results

The build is triggered.

With debug logging enabled, we can see change detection is ran every 3 minutes for the affected plan
h3. Workaround

Use file exclusion configuration for the non bitbucket server repository to prevent mis firing of plans.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server repository triggered introduces polling on all repos

fields.description:

fields.summary: Xcode plugin doesn't work with Bamboo 5.14.x

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the new permission - *Create repository* - announced in [Bamboo v5.11 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+5.11+Release+Notes] a user / group under this permission should also have access to the {{Plan configuration >> Branches}} tab and manage the branches associated to a particular plan.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a Group in Bamboo (_i.e. bamboo-repository_)
# create a User (_i.e. user-repo_) and add it to the Group above
# grant {{Edit}} permission to the user to a particular plan that has a repository
(i) By granting the permission, user is able to edit (_partially_) plan configuration
# log in to Bamboo as User above
# attempt on adding a branch under {{Plan configuration >> Branches}} tab

h3. Expected Results
* user should be able to add branch

h3. Actual Results
* user *is not* able to add branch and the following gets displayed in the UI
{panel:bgColor=#FEEFB3}
(!)   You must have plan admin permission to manage branches.
{panel}
fields.summary: Create repository permission should also grant branch creation

fields.description:
The bamboo_shortPlanName environment variable contains the plan name when building the default branch, but contains the branch name for branch builds.  I consider this a defect, not a improvement. But your JIRA configuration wouldn't allow be to create a "bug" and told me to raise a support ticket, and your support staff told me to file an enhancement request.

While the bamboo_buildPlanName and bamboo_planName contain the plan name, it can not be extracted with 100% reliably because the character sequence " - " used to delimit project and plan names are valid in project and plan names themselves.

I filed BAM-17988 to request a new environment variable for the project name, but to be truly useful we also need a plan name environment variable that contains the plan name (it makes no sense to me why bamboo_shortPlanName does not).

In general, I find it more separate values more useful than composite or derived values. It's usually easy to paste two or more variables together; it's often much harder (or impossible) to extract individual values from a composite.  For example, I averaged 60 miles/hour on my commute this morning – how long did I take to get to work?

Ideally there wouldn't be variables like bamboo_buildPlanName or bamboo_planName at all, as users that need a string with project name + plan name + branch name + job name could construct it out of component parts (Of course, now that these exists they can't be removed, I'm just using this an example of the principle).
fields.summary: bamboo_shortPlanName environment variable doesn't actually contain plan name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Build Plan with Gatekeeper enabled
 # Run a build that should push to your gatekeeper branch

h3. Expected Results

The push completes successfully and the build continues.
h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
While the Bamboo project and plan name are provided together in bamboo_buildPlanName and bamboo_planName environment variables, they can't be 100% reliably parsed as the " - " character sequence is valid in project and plan names themselves.

There is a bamboo_shortPlanName environment variable, but nothing for the project name.
fields.summary: Provide project name as separate environment variable

fields.description:
Bamboo agent service can be started and stopped by hand using service bamboo-agent [start|stop|status] etc, but systemd does not recognizes the service, so it cannot be registered for startup at boot time.

It seems Tanuki Software addressed the systemd/script issue on [Wrapper version 3.5.26|https://wrapper.tanukisoftware.com/doc/english/release-notes.html#3.5.26]: _Add the ability to control the service with systemd using the script file._
"sh.script.in" from Wrapper version 3.5.26
{code}
#! /bin/sh

#
# Copyright (c) 1999, 2014 Tanuki Software, Ltd.
# http://www.tanukisoftware.com
# All rights reserved.
#
# This software is the proprietary information of Tanuki Software.
# You shall use it only in accordance with the terms of the
# license agreement you entered into with Tanuki Software.
# http://wrapper.tanukisoftware.com/doc/english/licenseOverview.html
#
# Java Service Wrapper sh script.  Suitable for starting and stopping
#  wrapped Java applications on UNIX platforms.
#

#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# These settings can be modified to fit the needs of your application
# Optimized for use with version 3.5.26 of the Wrapper.

# IMPORTANT - Please always stop and uninstall an application before making
#             any changes to this file.  Failure to do so could remove the
#             script's ability to control the application.
...
# OS service management tool: flag for using systemd when installing
USE_SYSTEMD=
...
{code}

...but Bamboo uses an older "Wrapper" version (Version 3.2.3-atlassian-1).
fields.summary: Update the remote agents wrapper start/stop script (bamboo-agent.sh) to make it work with Linux Systemd.
Export Plan YAML from Plan Branch

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 Repository names are truncated in the new Branch Status drop down, so users are unable to find their Repository if they only differ near the end of the name

h3. Suggested Solution
Wrap the repository names or extend the size of the dropdown when open.

h3. Workaround
Add a unique value to the start of your Repository's name, for example if your Repositories are named as below:
* ThisIsALongNameForMyRepo1
* ThisIsALongNameForMyRepo2
* ThisIsALongNameForMyRepo3

You could add something before them, like:
* 001 ThisIsALongNameForMyRepo1
* 002 ThisIsALongNameForMyRepo2
* 003 ThisIsALongNameForMyRepo3
fields.summary: Repository Names are Truncated in Branch Status page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Bamboo does not display all users retrieved from LDAP under {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> Users}}, rendering only 4 pages.

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v5.12.3.1
* Windows Active Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# set up {{atlassian-user.xml}} or {{atlassian-user-custom.xml}} with LDAP
{code:xml}
<atlassian-user>
    <repositories>
        <ldap key="ldapRepository" name="yourRepository" cache="true">
                <host>HOSTNAME</host>
                <port>389</port>
                <securityPrincipal>cn=ADMINISTRATOR,ou=USERS,dc=company,dc=com</securityPrincipal>
                <securityCredential>PASSWORD</securityCredential>
                <securityProtocol>plain</securityProtocol>
                <securityAuthentication>simple</securityAuthentication>

                <baseContext>dc=company,dc=com</baseContext>
                <baseUserNamespace>ou=USERS,dc=company,dc=com</baseUserNamespace>
                <userSearchFilter>(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*))</userSearchFilter>
                <usernameAttribute>sAMAccountName</usernameAttribute>
                <firstnameAttribute>givenname</firstnameAttribute>
                <surnameAttribute>sn</surnameAttribute>
                <emailAttribute>mail</emailAttribute>
                <userSearchAllDepths>true</userSearchAllDepths>

                <baseGroupNamespace>dc=company,dc=com</baseGroupNamespace>
                <groupnameAttribute>cn</groupnameAttribute>
                <groupSearchFilter>(objectClass=Group)</groupSearchFilter>
                <membershipAttribute>member</membershipAttribute>
                <groupSearchAllDepths>true</groupSearchAllDepths>
        </ldap>
        <hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository" description="Hibernate Repository" cache="true"/>
    </repositories>
</atlassian-user>
{code}
# start Bamboo and make sure "{{Custom repository}}" is selected under "{{Bamboo administration >> Security >> User repositories}}"
# go to {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> Users}}

h3. Expected Results
* display all pages so all users can be displayed

h3. Actual Results
* Bamboo cannot display all users and the below exception is thrown in {{catalina.out}} file:
{code}
com.atlassian.user.impl.RepositoryException: javax.naming.PartialResultException: Unprocessed Continuation Reference(s); remaining name 'dc=company,dc=com'
Caused by: javax.naming.PartialResultException: Unprocessed Continuation Reference(s); remaining name 'dc=company,dc=com'
{code}

h3. Notes
{panel:bgColor=#FEEFB3}
(!)   The issue seems not prevent users that are not listed under {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> Users}} from logging in against Bamboo
{panel}

h3.Workaround
* No workaround available till present
fields.summary: LDAP Unprocessed Continuation Reference

-- Stop Bamboo
-- Uncomment upgrade task by editing {{<Bamboo Install Directory>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/upgrades.xml}} again. I.e. put it back like:
{code:xml}
<upgrade build="51410" class="com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v5_14.UpgradeTask51410FixStashSshKeys"/>
{code}
-- Change {{buildNumber}} in {{bamboo.cfg.xml}} in your *$BAMBOO_HOME* to one before the commented upgrade task which is {{51409}} in this case
-- Start Bamboo

(i) This guarantees that when upgrading Bamboo in the future, task {{51410}} will be executed again.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

SSH script is not found when running Tasks such as "Source Code Checkout"

h3. Environment
* Windows
* Local or Remote Agent
* Running Bamboo as Service under SYSTEM user

h3. Expected Results

Build runs as expected

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:
{noformat}
error: cannot spawn C:\Windows\system32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Local\Temp\bamboo-ssh.[randomstring].bat: No such file or directory
{noformat}
 
h3.Workarounds

# Set a new temporary directory that is not under that path
# Run as Service under a user other than SYSTEM
fields.summary: Bamboo SSH script not found when running as a Windows Service under the System User

fields.description:
Ok, ok, I'm relatively new at Bamboo. But I'm a huge fan of the Atlassian productivity tools, light years ahead of most places I've worked.  But... I wasted a big chunk of time searching for a project and not finding it!  I simply overlooked the "Show More Projects" button.  My bad, I know, RTFM.  But... I DO feel that should be more obvious, and even more ideally, scrolling should be infinite (even if you have to fetch the next chunk at runtime.)  I'll attempt to add the picture to this message.  Thanks, Jon G., Boston.

!image-2016-10-28-08-56-51-382.png!
fields.summary: "Show More Plans" button not obvious enough

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Job Queue Timeout notification is not sent when user in commits can't be associate with Bamboo user

h3. Environment
 * Bamboo v5.10.x
 * Bamboo v5.12.x
 * Bamboo v5.13.x
 * Bamboo v5.14.01

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * set up {{Job Queue Timeout}} as {{Event}} under {{Plan configuration >> Notifications}} tab
 * select {{Notification recipient}}
 * run a build making it timeout on queue

h3. Expected Results
 * WARN message should be presented informing Notification will not be sent out to user(s) A, B and C because no match was found with users in Bamboo

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:
{noformat}Error executing macro: displayAuthorOrProfileLink
required parameter: author is not specified.
The problematic instruction:
----------
==> macro displayAuthorOrProfileLink [on line 488, column 1 in freemarker-lib/ui.ftl]
 in user-directive ui.displayAuthorOrProfileLink [on line 366, column 38 in notification-templates/notificationCommonsHtml.ftl]
 in user-directive showCommitsNoBuildResult [on line 12, column 5 in notification-templates/BuildQueueTimeoutHtmlEmail.ftl]
 in user-directive templateOuter [on line 10, column 1 in notification-templates/BuildQueueTimeoutHtmlEmail.ftl]
----------
{noformat}
fields.summary: Job Queue Timeout notification error

fields.description:
h3. Purpose
As an administrator I'd like to have my Bamboo job email the link of the pull request that started the job (along with the link to the job itself and the location of the binaries it built). If this information was available in a Bamboo variable, that would be ideal.

In general, I think having the link to the pull request in the Bamboo job's summary (similar to what we have in JIRA) would be handy for users too. Bamboo currently shows a list of commits but the pull request would have the nicely formatted diffs along with any comments from the code review.
fields.summary: Improve pull request notifications in Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Purpose
Bamboo doesn't set the HOME environment variable when installing remote agents and thus when attempting to checkout submodules when the agent is installed as a service will fail as the config is overridden. 

h3. Workaround
# Disable submodules in the plan repository
# Added a script task that issues the command "git submodule update --init --recursive", with an environment variable HOME set to C:\Users\username
fields.summary: Improve submodule checkout in Bamboo via remote agents installed as service

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Repository password is not kept when using {{Import a Maven project}}

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v5.14.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* under {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> System}} select {{Import a Maven project}}
* under {{Enter pom.xml details}}, select {{Subversion}} as {{Repository host}}
* select {{Password}} as {{Authentication type}}
* hit {{Import}}
* under {{Confirm plan details}} create the Project / Plan for this import
* under {{Repositories}} section you will notice:
||Authentication type|Password|
| |\[ \] Change password?|
(i) Which means there is a password already defined
* under {{Enable this plan?}}, check {{Yes please!}}
* {{Confirm}} so the plan gets created

h3. Expected Results
A build is automatically triggered and checkout and Maven task runs successfully

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log.log}} file:
{noformat}
Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNAuthenticationException: svn: E170001: Authentication required for '<http://svn.webserver:80> Subversion Repository(s)'

        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVConnection.open(DAVConnection.java:102)

        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc2.ng.SvnNgRepositoryAccess.getRevisionNumber(SvnNgRepositoryAccess.java:118)

        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc2.remote.SvnRemoteGetInfo.run(SvnRemoteGetInfo.java:31)

fields.description:
h3. User Story

As a Bamboo user, I would like Script tasks to be able to use Shared Credentials in the same way as SSH and SCP tasks.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add Shared Credentials feature to script tasks
fields.summary: Ability to use Shared Credentials on Script Task

fields.description:
Bamboo allows executing unit and integration tests, displaying the execution results.

Each test has title and description, which are actually parsed from the name of test method. Attaching a screenshot for the reference.

As test method, title and description basically have the same text, they're not very useful now. It would be nice to have an ability to specify title and description. As a developer, I'd be extremely pleased if bamboo had an ability to parse title and description from JavaDocs (whenever they're available). First sentence can be used as title, the whole itself - as description.
fields.summary: Allow specifying additional description for unit/integration test

fields.description:
I have a separate plan for integration tests, which is executed in two cases:
 - child execution when build plan is executed successfully;
 - scheduled nightly execution.

First one should be executed for the each branch - this allows to identify problems in time.

But the scheduled one should be executed only for master - otherwise some of the tests fail due to concurrent execution.

To solve this, I need one of the options:
 - ability to disable "inheritance" for triggers from master to other branches;
 - ability to disallow concurrent branch executions within a plan.

Could you please implement something to help me resolving the issue?
fields.summary: Prevent concurrent branch executions within a plan

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Our add-on [Automation with AWS (Bamboo)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.utoolity.atlassian.bamboo.automation-with-aws-bamboo/server/overview] implements an "Automate with AWS" notification recipient. When using this recipient in a plan notification, a reinstall (or disable/enable cycle) of the add-on triggers the following ServiceProxyDestroyedException (also see attached Bamboo log excerpt) when trying to view or edit the plan notification afterwards, resulting in no content being displayed for the notification on view or edit:
{noformat}
2016-10-20 17:22:50,804 ERROR [http-nio-6990-exec-9] [AwsActionNotificationRecipient] Failed to render edit html: 
org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.ServiceProxyDestroyedException: service proxy has been destroyed
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor$ServiceLookUpCallback.doWithRetry(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:101)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.support.RetryTemplate.execute(RetryTemplate.java:81)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.lookupService(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:427)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.getTarget(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:400)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
    at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:70)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
    at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:207)
    at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1386.getLicense(Unknown Source)
    at net.utoolity.atlassian.dry.licensing.LicenseCheck.ensureValidLicense(LicenseCheck.java:86)
    at net.utoolity.atlassian.dry.licensing.LicenseCheck.ensureValidLicense(LicenseCheck.java:62)
    at net.utoolity.atlassian.aaws.bamboo.AwsActionNotificationRecipient.getEditHtml(AwsActionNotificationRecipient.java:286)

{noformat}


(i) NOTE: This problem only occurs for build plan notifications, _not_ for system notifications.
h4. Steps to reproduce:
 * Install [Automation with AWS (Bamboo)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.utoolity.atlassian.bamboo.automation-with-aws-bamboo/server/overview]
 * Configure at least one System Scope connector under {{plugins/servlet/identity-federation-for-aws/configuration/aws-connector}} (this does not have to be based on real AWS credentials, a dummy entry will do for the repro case)
 * Add a Plan level notification using the "Automate with AWS" recipient type (again, any entries will do, e.g. selecting the dummy connector created above, an arbitrary action and an empty JSON "\{}" for the Parameters field just to pass validation)
 * Disable the add-on
 * Enable the add-on
 * Try to edit the notification created above (or just refresh the Plan Notifications page) - _this will trigger the SPDE, logged to the main Bamboo log._

h4. Partial workaround

We have not found a way to prevent this exception, but once the issue occurs, it can be fixed by adding/removing a dummy notification:
 * Add an arbitrary new dummy notification (for example, notify a User and select yourself).
 * The notification list should now surface your intended edit on the original notification.
 * Delete the dummy notification again.

This seems to trigger a complete refresh of the involved NotificationRecipient instances, thus fixing the issue.
fields.summary: Bamboo retains instance of custom NotificationRecipient after add-on uninstalled

fields.description:
_As a Bamboo user_

_I want Bamboo to ensure the entire build-job directory is empty in advance to running a job therein_

_so that builds do not fail due to leftover from previous builds_

Notes:
 * Job option "Clean working directory after each build" as a post step seems not be sufficient since it is obviously not be performed in certain cases, e.g. Bamboo / host shutdown and HBK.
 * Source Code Checkout option "Force Clean Build" is not sufficient since in the case the checkout is done into a sub-directory "Checkout Directory" (required when build depends on several repositories), this option takes care only of the sub-directory(s).

I just see two possibilities to fix build issues due to leftovers of previous builds
 * cleaning up *entire* work directory before / as the first task of every build
 * configuring Bamboo to include the build number into the path of the current build directory (preferred)

Are there any option for one or the other?

PS: In our team, we recently discussed removing any created files by our own, however came to the conclusion that it is worse strategy with no guaranty that nothing else is being removed from build hosts unintentionally. If unique build directories are not possible, Bamboo tooling should be used to ensure clean directories beforehand of a build.
fields.summary: Clean entire work directories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a user I would like a clear and automated migration path between database types (E.g. From Embedded HSQL to External DB) as the current process requires a few too many manual steps that could be handled through the UI (like in Bitbucket Server)

h3. Suggested Solution
A database migration wizard where the user sets target database connection string. The system will automatically backup the current instance / generate the export and import it to the target database. If successful, user is then prompted to restart Bamboo. The connection string is automatically updated to point to the new target DB for the next start-up.

Optionally, we can choose to tear down the embedded database as part of the process.

h3. Current process
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Moving+your+Bamboo+data+to+a+different+database
fields.summary: Migration wizard between different database types

I have a lot of script tasks that need to be executed one after other, just in different working directory, and the current way in bamboo for each of them I need to select script task and fill it every time.

Please add clone task. 
Thanks!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo Docker plugin does unnecessary call for host port when it is provided in configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create plan
 # add Docker task
 # pick command "Run Docker container"
 # select "Detach container"
 # add port mapping
 # select "Wait for service to start"

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo will use port provided in the mapping for testing service availability.

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo uses port provided in the mapping for testing service availability but still queries Docker using
{noformat}
docker inspect --format='{{(index (index .NetworkSettings.Ports "<port>/tcp") 0).HostPort}}' <container-name>
{noformat}
This also makes this operation fail on Windows (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-17959)

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Docker plugin should not query for host port when it is provided in configuration

fields.description:
h4. Context

h4. Problem

It appears the scp task uses: 

https://github.com/hierynomus/sshj/blob/master/src/main/java/net/schmizz/sshj/xfer/scp/SCPEngine.java

Lines 74-76 have a default response if the return code is greater than 1 that does not display the remoteMessage.  The suggestion is to change it so that if greater than 1 AND remoteMessage is null or empty string, then do the default response; otherwise, it would be helpful with troubleshooting if the remoteMessage is displayed if rc is greater than 1.  

We had a case where scp was closing connection and throwing the default message without saying why that took a lot of effort to figure out (stumbled on solution).  If the remoteMessage had displayed, we would have saved a lot of our time and your time.
fields.summary: SCP task should show the error code for every error

fields.description:
[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43340519/how-to-fetch-all-builds-of-a-bamboo-plan-from-rest-api]

I am trying to fetch all builds of a plan from Bamboo rest API. but its giving me only 25 builds.

*API URL*: [https://localhost:8085/rest/api/latest/result/PROJECTKEY-PLANKEY.json]

As per the [official documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bamboodev/rest-apis/bamboo-rest-resources#BambooRESTResources-GeneralInformation]
{quote}
The number of resources in returned lists is limited to 25, unless you specify max-result.
{quote}
Hence for workaround, I thought I can fetch build size in first api call and pass size in second api call as {{max-results}} parameter. So that it will give me all builds for a plan. But first API call ( with max-results=1) giving me {{size}} 1 whereas same is working for fetching size of the projects.

*API call to get the build size:* (Not Working)

[https://localhost:8085/rest/api/latest/result/PROJECTKEY-PLANKEY.json?max-results=1]

*{{output}}*: size=1, max-result=1 (Whereas plan has 33 builds)

*{{expected output}}*: size=33, max-result=1

[https://localhost:8085/rest/api/latest/result/PROJECTKEY-PLANKEY.json?max-results=PASS-SIZE-HERE]

*Working API to get the Project Size:*

[https://localhost:8085/rest/api/latest/project.json?max-results=1]

*{{output}}*: size=30, max-result=1

My question here, Can we fetch all BUILDS of a PLAN? as by default its only fetching 25 builds.
fields.summary: Result resource shows incorrect size of build results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The following command does not work when run on Docker for Windows version 1.12
{code}
docker.exe inspect --format='{{(index (index .NetworkSettings.Ports "$port_number/tcp") 0).HostPort}}' $instance_name
{code}

It works on linux and OSX.

This affects Deployment Tasks.


h3. Environment
* Windows 10
* Docker for Windows 1.12
* Docker Deployment Task added with Port Mapping set

h3. Expected Results
Port settings returned.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the Build log:
{noformat}
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	Failing task since return code of [\path\to\docker.exe inspect --format='{{(index (index .NetworkSettings.Ports "$port_number/tcp") 0).HostPort}}' $instance_id] was 64 while expected 0
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	Error occurred while running Task 'Run Docker Container(4)' of type com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-docker-plugin:task.docker.cli.
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskException: Failed to execute task
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.service.RunService.execute(RunService.java:70)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.tasks.cli.DockerCliTask.execute(DockerCliTask.java:60)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.lambda$executeTasks$203(TaskExecutorImpl.java:317)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.executeTaskWithPrePostActions(TaskExecutorImpl.java:246)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.executeTasks(TaskExecutorImpl.java:317)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.execute(TaskExecutorImpl.java:118)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.tasks.ExecuteBuildTask.call(ExecuteBuildTask.java:74)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent.build(DefaultBuildAgent.java:215)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl$1.call(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:139)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl$1.call(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:130)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.variable.CustomVariableContextImpl.withVariableSubstitutor(CustomVariableContextImpl.java:221)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl.waitAndPerformBuild(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:129)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent$1.run(DefaultBuildAgent.java:137)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooRunnables$1.run(BambooRunnables.java:51)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWith(ImpersonationHelper.java:31)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWithSystemAuthority(ImpersonationHelper.java:20)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper$1.run(ImpersonationHelper.java:52)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.client.DockerException: Error running Docker inspect command
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.client.DockerCmd.getHostPort(DockerCmd.java:144)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.service.RunService.getServiceUrl(RunService.java:143)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.service.RunService.execute(RunService.java:63)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        ... 17 more
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	Caused by: com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Error executing \path\to\docker.exe inspect --format='{{(index (index .NetworkSettings.Ports "$port_number/tcp") 0).HostPort}}' $instance_id
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.process.DockerTaskProcessService.execute(DockerTaskProcessService.java:60)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.docker.client.DockerCmd.getHostPort(DockerCmd.java:140)
19-Oct-2016 09:02:53	        ... 19 more
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
You can use a Script Task before the Docker Task, to wait for the port to open. This can be done with a PowerShell or CMD command like [this|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22430326/loop-until-ipport-is-responding] or [this|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29526342/windows-batch-script-to-see-if-a-sequence-of-server-ports-is-open]. You will need to write out the Docker commands that you want to use.

h3. External links
This issue was initially reported to Docker here:  https://github.com/docker/toolbox/issues/433
But the recommended fix doesn't work in this case.

We opened this ticket to follow-up:  https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/27592
fields.summary: Docker Inspect command does not work on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When certain records contain ASCII NUL ( X'00' ) the Bamboo XML export will fail with *Invalid null character* as soon as it hits that record. The failure is covered in: BAM-17948

This bug is related to the error not always being visible in the UI after the export, sometimes Bamboo reports that the export was successful despite the error which can be misleading for administrators who are relying on that being accurate to confirm integrity of their export / backup.
h3. Environment
 * MySQL as the database engine

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Spin up a fresh instance connected to MySQL
 # Create a build plan
 # Add an inject variable task > Load the attached {{test.prop}} in with result scope
 # Build the plan
 # Bamboo Admin > Export (with results)

Alternatively, method *does* show that the export failed:
 # Spin up a fresh instance connected to MySQL
 # Create a build plan
 # Add a plan variable through the UI
 # Build the plan
 # Update the VARIABLE_VALUE in VARIABLE_DEFINITION to contain the ASCII NUL via SQL
 # Bamboo Admin > Export

Note: Builds on PostgreSQL fail to inject the variable.
h3. Expected Results

If there is a failure with the export, it should be accurately reported to the UI.
h3. Actual Results
 * Bamboo UI reports: (/) Bamboo has successfully exported
 * The resulting export zip is incomplete. _projects.xml_ is truncated at point of failure.
 * The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:

com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.SMOutputElementAppender.appendIfNotBlank(SMOutputElementAppender.java:119) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.stream.VariableContextSnapshotMapper.exportProperties(VariableContextSnapshotMapper.java:59) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.stream.VariableContextSnapshotMapper.exportProperties(VariableContextSnapshotMapper.java:17) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXMappingHelperAbstractImpl.exportXml(BambooStAXMappingHelperAbstractImpl.java:111) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXMappingListHelperAbstractImpl.exportListXml(BambooStAXMappingListHelperAbstractImpl.java:176) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXMappingListHelperAbstractImpl.exportListXml(BambooStAXMappingListHelperAbstractImpl.java:154) at fields.description:
https://docs.atlassian.com/bamboo/REST/5.13.2/#d2e863

The documentation states that the response will be a JSON document, but the example is in XML format.

I have not checked all examples, but this inconsistency is present in a LOT of API response examples.

fields.description:
Hi, I would like to be able to integrate DotCover code coverage reports into my Bamboo builds.


h3. User story

As a Bamboo user who runs software builds
I want integration with DotCover code coverage reports
So that I can see quality metrics alongside the other build logs
fields.summary: Support for DotCover code coverage reports

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using custom revision to queue a build there is no lock placed on the git cache. Because there's no lock present, when two or more threads fetch on the same directory we encounter git's own protection against concurrent access. The second fetch will fail but then Bamboo detects that the fetch has failed and in an attempt to restore consistency, removes the cache. This causes the other builds to fail when the cache is removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the concurrent build limit to 6
# Concurrent calls to {{/rest/api/latest/queue/PROJ-PLAN?customRevision=revisionhash}} to plans that share the same git cache (Key is defined by combination of repository URL & username) e.g. {code}seq 6 | parallel curl -u admin:password -X POST http://bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/PROJ-PLAN?customRevision=52b8b228d81723b56be98c1c2ad299bd1b43baa0q!{code}

h3. Expected Results
Lock is placed on the cache so concurrent plans using the same cache with a custom revision don't fail.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.stash.repository.StashRepositoryException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: : Cannot fetch branch 'refs/heads/*' from 'ssh://git@bitbucket:7999/proj/repo.git' to source directory '/var/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir/_git-repositories-cache/xxx'. fatal: FETCH_HEAD is empty after fetch.
{noformat}

Multiple plans using the same cache that are triggered using custom revision fail, while some succeed. The number of failing plans and which plans fail, is random.

h3.Workaround
# Use git repository with HTTP authentication and different usernames on each plan so that the cache is separate per build.
# Use a script task to execute the source code checkout to bypass the git cache and fetch directly from the repository. Pass the revision in using a variable e.g. {code}POST http://bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/PROJ-PLA?bamboo.variable.customCommit=52b8b228d81723b56be98c1c2ad299bd1b43baa0q{code}
fields.summary: Queuing builds with custom revision does not lock the git cache to protect from concurrent access

fields.description:
h4. Context

When adding a new repository as linked repository or straight to a plan the following option is checked by default: *Admin >> Linked Repositories >> (selected Repository) >> Use shallow clones*. This makes Bamboo to shallow clone the repository which is not cloned with the full history. This behavior is not desired when planning to push or merge to or from the referred repository.

In some cases this won't create any problems in others this could lead to unnecessary conflicts. This is what we see in git manual:
{quote}
A [shallow clone|https://git-scm.com/docs/user-manual/2.8.0#def_shallow_clone], with its truncated history, is useful when one is interested only in recent history of a project and getting full history from the upstream is expensive.

A [shallow clone|https://git-scm.com/docs/user-manual/2.8.0#def_shallow_clone] is created by specifying the [git\-fetch\[1\]|https://git-scm.com/docs/git-fetch] *\-\-depth* switch. The depth can later be changed with the [git\-fetch\[1\]|https://git-scm.com/docs/git-fetch] *\-\-depth* switch, or full history restored with *\-\-unshallow*.

Merging inside a [shallow clone|https://git-scm.com/docs/user-manual/2.8.0#def_shallow_clone] will work as long as a merge base is in the recent history. Otherwise, it will be like merging unrelated histories and may have to result in huge conflicts. This limitation may make such a repository unsuitable to be used in merge based workflows.
{quote}
^Reference: [How to get a Git repository with minimal history - Git \- user\-manual Documentation|https://git-scm.com/docs/user-manual.html]^

There are also some threads about this subject:
* [git \- Pushing to github after a shallow clone \- Stack Overflow|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11375070/pushing-to-github-after-a-shallow-clone]
* [git \- Why can't I push from a shallow clone? \- Stack Overflow|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6900103/why-cant-i-push-from-a-shallow-clone]

h4. Problem

The Automatic branch merge feature([Using plan branches \- Bamboo latest \(5.13\) \- Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+plan+branches#Usingplanbranches-Automaticbranchmerging]) does not seem to validate if the referenced repository is *shallow cloned* or *full cloned* which leads to a sensitive behavior. Also the *use shallow clones* option is set by default in the advanced options depending on how a user creates the repository (please refer to *Notes* section bellow).

h4. Suggestion

# Add a validation to avoid using *shallow clones* when the *Automatic branch merge feature is used.
# Do not check the *use shallow clones* option by default when setting any repository.

h4. Notes
# The option *Use shallow clones* is not checked by default if the repository is associated during the plan creation.
# The option *Use shallow clones* is checked when a linked repository is created or when a new repository is associated to an existing plan.
fields.summary: Add a validation to avoid shallow clones when using automatic branch merges

fields.description:
h4. *SUMMARY*

Bamboo deletes plan branches after expiry period if a VCS branch had been deleted, even if that VCS branch had been recreated afterwards.
h4. *SCENARIO*
 - VCS branch created in repository, e.g. "B1"
 - Bamboo detects the branch and creates a plan branch for it
 - VCS branch "B1" deleted from repository
 - Bamboo detects the deletion of "B1", disables plan branch and schedules it's deletion
 - VCS branch "B1" recreated in repository
 - Bamboo ignores it and deletes the plan branch after expiry period (e.g. 7 days)
 - Bamboo will never re-create plan branch for "B1" automatically

h4. *WORKAROUND*
 - use different branch name
 - (available after BAM-16505) after the plan branch is deleted (after expiry period), manually re-create it in Bamboo

h4. *FIX SUGGESTION*

Detect that a VCS branch had been recreated and react, e.g.:
 - re-enable plan branch & no longer schedule it for deletion, or
 - create a new plan branch for it, keeping the old one still in queue for deletion
fields.summary: Branch clean up deletes plan branch even if VCS branch was deleted and recreated

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The [Oracle \- Bamboo latest \(5\.13\) \- Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Oracle] has the following info on an *Important* note.

{quote}
Note that the JDBC driver for Oracle 11g (Oracle 11.2.0.1.0) is no longer bundled (since version 5.1). You need to download and install the driver from the Oracle website yourself.
{quote}

This information is very confuse. First of all this version of Bamboo does not support Oracle 11c. Secondly it's not very clear that you need to download the driver since Bamboo is bundled with the version 11.2.0.2.0. The comment is not clear if we should download only if the driver is the one cited or if we need to download always.

The adjust in this document will depend on a development decision to remove or not the bundled driver.
If the driver will stay bundled, should this comment be removed?
Or should it be adjusted it telling the users to always download the driver matching the oracle database in use?
fields.summary: Adjust documentation warning about the Oracle driver

fields.description:
As an admin I would like to ask for an investigation about the oracle driver bundled with Bamboo since I'm facing problems when using the bundled version (ojdbc6-11.2.0.2.0.jar).
When switching this version to (ojdbc6-11.2.0.4.0.jar) the problem is gone. 
Also, according to [Oracle Database 11g Release 2 JDBC Driver Downloads|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/apps-tech/jdbc-112010-090769.html] the bundled driver seems to be certified to *Classes for use with JDK 1.6* only and Bamboo is now using JDK 8.

It's also a good idea to evaluate a newer driver since Bamboo is now restricted to Oracle 12c.
* [Oracle Database 12c Release 1 JDBC Driver Downloads|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/jdbc-drivers-12c-download-1958347.html]
fields.summary: Update the Oracle JDBC driver bundled for Bamboo to a newer vesion

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When certain records contain ASCII NUL ( X'00' ) the Bamboo XML export will fail with *Invalid null character* as soon as it hits that record. 

This error is not always visible in the UI, sometimes Bamboo reports that the export was successful despite the error. A separate bug report exists for this: [BAM-17957|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-17957]

The current columns where we've encountered this: 
* VARIABLE_VALUE and VARIABLE_KEY in table VARIABLE_CONTEXT (offending data appears to be loaded via Inject variables)
* VARIABLE_VALUE and VARIABLE_KEY in table VARIABLE_DEFINITION (offending data appears to be loaded via Inject variables)
* FAILURE_REASON in table MERGE_RESULT
* CUSTOM_INFO_KEY and CUSTOM_INFO_VALUE in BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA
* MSG in AUDIT_LOG
* KEY_IDENTIFIER and VALUE in CAPABILITY 
* NEW_VALUE in AUDIT_LOG

We have also experienced this in the past with data in AUTH_ATTEMPT_INFO which was fixed in 5.10: [BAM-15093 Exclude AUTH_ATTEMPT_INFO from Bamboo's backup|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-15093]

h3. Environment
* MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle as the database engine

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Spin up a fresh instance connected to MySQL 
# Create a build plan
# Add an inject variable task > Load the attached {{test.prop}} in with result scope
# Build the plan
# Bamboo Admin > Export (with results)

Alternatively 
# Spin up a fresh instance connected to MySQL 
# Create a build plan
# Add a plan variable through the UI
# Build the plan
# Update the VARIABLE_VALUE in VARIABLE_DEFINITION to contain the ASCII NUL via SQL
# Bamboo Admin > Export 

Note: Builds on PostgreSQL fail to inject the variable.

h3. Expected Results
XML export would succeed, stripping the invalid null character

h3. Actual Results
The resulting export zip is incomplete. _projects.xml_ is truncated at point of failure.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{code}

h3. Notes
Affected data can be identified on MySQL with queries such as:
{code}
select * from VARIABLE_DEFINITION where VARIABLE_VALUE like '%\0%';
select * from VARIABLE_DEFINITION where VARIABLE_KEY like '%\0%';
select * from VARIABLE_CONTEXT where VARIABLE_VALUE like '%\0%';
select * from VARIABLE_CONTEXT where VARIABLE_KEY like '%\0%';
select * from MERGE_RESULT where FAILURE_REASON like '%\0%';
select * from BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA where CUSTOM_INFO_KEY like '%\0%';
select * from BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA where CUSTOM_INFO_VALUE like '%\0%';
select * from AUDIT_LOG where MSG like '%\0%';
select * from AUDIT_LOG where NEW_VALUE like '%\0%';
select * from CAPABILITY where KEY_IDENTIFIER like '%\0%';
select * from CAPABILITY where VALUE like '%\0%';
{code}

Microsoft SQL Server:
{code}
SELECT * FROM VARIABLE_DEFINITION WHERE CAST(VARIABLE_VALUE as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM VARIABLE_DEFINITION WHERE CAST(VARIABLE_KEY as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM VARIABLE_CONTEXT WHERE CAST(VARIABLE_VALUE as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM VARIABLE_CONTEXT WHERE CAST(VARIABLE_KEY as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM MERGE_RESULT WHERE CAST(FAILURE_REASON as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA WHERE CAST(CUSTOM_INFO_KEY as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA WHERE CAST(CUSTOM_INFO_VALUE as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM AUDIT_LOG WHERE CAST(MSG as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM AUDIT_LOG WHERE CAST(NEW_VALUE as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM CAPABILITY WHERE CAST(KEY_IDENTIFIER as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
SELECT * FROM CAPABILITY WHERE CAST(VALUE as varchar(max)) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS like '%' + CHAR(0) + '%';
{code}

Oracle:
{code}
select * from VARIABLE_DEFINITION where VARIABLE_VALUE like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from VARIABLE_DEFINITION where VARIABLE_KEY like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from VARIABLE_CONTEXT where VARIABLE_VALUE like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from VARIABLE_CONTEXT where VARIABLE_KEY like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from MERGE_RESULT where FAILURE_REASON like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA where CUSTOM_INFO_KEY like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA where CUSTOM_INFO_VALUE like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from AUDIT_LOG where MSG like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from AUDIT_LOG where NEW_VALUE like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from CAPABILITY where KEY_IDENTIFIER like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
select * from CAPABILITY where VALUE like '%' ||chr(0)|| '%';
{code}
fields.summary: ASCII NUL in data with MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle causing the Bamboo export / scheduled backups to fail with Invalid null character in text to output

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 Attempting to add a mail server from the plan configuration page fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any plan configuration page.
 # Select the "Notifications" tab.
 # Select the "Add an email server" link.

h3. Expected Results

Modal window appears with configuration options.
h3. Actual Results

Modal window opens but just displays spinner.
 The exception below appears in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:

fields.description:
As a *Bamboo user* creating jobs by *cloning* from existing
 I would like to see hints at all *disabled* original jobs in the select boxes
 so that I am warned those jobs may not be working with the latest repo revision anymore.

This would give me the options to either choose such one nevertheless (in order to modify it afterwards) or clone from quite another job.

Example: see attached [^mock-up.png]
fields.summary: Hinting disabled jobs in job clone select boxes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Inject Bamboo variables task to save a huge variable into database might hit into database column size limit

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Inject Bamboo variables task into a Build Plan
# Select the option "Results" scope of the variables
# Configure it to read a file with a variable more than 4000 characters

h3. Expected Results
Build will fail with a message that there is a variable more than 4000 characters

h3. Actual Results
Build fail with the following exception:
{noformat}
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not execute batch; SQL [insert into VARIABLE_CONTEXT (VARIABLE_KEY, VARIABLE_VALUE, VARIABLE_TYPE, BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID, VARIABLE_CONTEXT_ID) values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?)]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not execute batch
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate4.SessionFactoryUtils.convertHibernateAccessException(SessionFactoryUtils.java:165)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate4.HibernateTemplate.doExecute(HibernateTemplate.java:343)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate4.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:295)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.BuildResultsSummaryHibernateDao.findLastResultBefore(BuildResultsSummaryHibernateDao.java:1499)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.BuildResultsSummaryManagerImpl.findLastResultBefore(BuildResultsSummaryManagerImpl.java:1347)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.BuildResultsSummaryManagerImpl.calculateAndSetDeltaState(BuildResultsSummaryManagerImpl.java:609)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
...
Caused by: org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not execute batch
...
Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'VARIABLE_VALUE' at row 1
...
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'VARIABLE_VALUE' at row 1
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Reduce the variable size to be less than 4000 characters
fields.summary: Better error handling when Inject Bamboo variables task try to save huge variable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a parent build fails in Bamboo, the child is not triggered
h3. Suggested Solution
Add another option to trigger builds if parent fails
 
h3. Workaround 
* [Bamboo Fail Build Trigger Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassianlab.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-fail-trigger/server/overview]
* Alternatively you can add script task utilizing the REST API to trigger build
{noformat}
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST http://host_name/rest/api/latest/queue/<project-plan>?stage&executeAllStages&customRevision
{noformat}
fields.summary: Allow the option to trigger dependent builds if parent fails

fields.description:
The scenario is as follows:

* Developer A makes a commit to a library X
* Library A builds successfully and kicks off the build of application Y
* Application Y build fails because application Y is not compatible with the changes made in library X
* Developer A is *not* notified

I would like the developer or developers that caused the downstream breakage to be notified.

This can be accomplished by looking at the metadata of the failing build.  This metadata contains all of the build plan's parents.  It should be easy to check if there are committers for those builds, and if so, assign them as responsible. 

The data is available in bamboo, just need to act on it :)
fields.summary: Responsible users are not propagated to child builds

fields.description: Use Clover 4.1.2 in Bamboo Clover Plugin.
fields.summary: Upgrade Bamboo Clover Plugin to Clover 4.1.2

fields.description: After rerunning failed stages, Bamboo seems to use the wrong icons for successful builds. Instead of the correct {{}} icon, Bamboo is generating {{}} which looks blurry on HiDPI screens.
fields.summary: Wrong icon used for successful builds in some cases

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Connecting to MySQL database with ANSI_QUOTES enabled will trigger an Unknown column exception for 'InnoDB':
{noformat}
2016-10-10 13:23:11,515 FATAL [localhost-startStop-1] [DefaultBootstrapManager] Pre-bootstrap upgrade tasks failed
com.atlassian.upgrade.UpgradeException: Pre-bootstrap validation tests failed: [Task for build 51012 failed with exception: Unknown column 'InnoDB' in 'where clause']
at com.atlassian.bamboo.setup.DefaultBootstrapManager.performPersistenceUpgrade(DefaultBootstrapManager.java:354)
at com.atlassian.config.bootstrap.DefaultAtlassianBootstrapManager.init(DefaultAtlassianBootstrapManager.java:77)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.setup.BootstrapLoaderListener.contextInitialized(BootstrapLoaderListener.java:118)
at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4842)
at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5303)
at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:147)
at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1407)
at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1397)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

{quote} ANSI_QUOTES

Treat “"” as an identifier quote character (like the “`” quote character) and not as a string quote character. You can still use “`” to quote identifiers with this mode enabled. With ANSI_QUOTES enabled, you cannot use double quotation marks to quote literal strings, because it is interpreted as an identifier.{quote}

Query being ran as apart of upgrade task 51012:
{noformat}
SHOW TABLE STATUS FROM `%s` WHERE ENGINE != \"InnoDB\""
{noformat}

h3. How to Replicate

* Install Bamboo 5.13.2 using MySQL with ANSI_QUOTES enabled

h3. Expected Behavior
* Query will run as expected to complete upgrade

h3. Actual Behavior
* Bamboo fails upgrade task with {{Unknown column 'InnoDB' in 'where clause'}}

h3. Diagnosis
# Please run the following queries to confirm ANSI_QUOTES are enabled:
{code:sql}SELECT @@GLOBAL.sql_mode;{code}
{code:sql}SELECT @@SESSION.sql_mode;{code}

h3. Workaround
# Remove ANSI_QUOTES from *sql-mode* in my.cnf
fields.summary: Pre-bootstrap validation tests failed: [Task for build 51012 failed with exception: Unknown column 'InnoDB' in 'where clause']

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the User Directory is changed, users lose their Favorites since IDs change. These can be difficult to reassign, especially if users have a lot of Favorites.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add feature to move/reassign Favorites when users are switched over
fields.summary: Move Favorites with Users when migrating to new User directory

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Repository Trigger for Stash/Bitbucket Server will trigger a build on any change in a repository. This can be an issue for users with large repositories, where a certain Build Plan only relates to a subdirectory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add functionality to trigger on changes to a specific subdirectory of a repository.
 
h3. Workaround
In the Linked Repository settings, you can use the "Include/exclude files" option:
# Go to {{Administration >> Linked repositories}}
# Select your repository, or create a new one
# Under "Advanced options" select "Include only changes that matches to the following pattern"
# Input a regular expression to search for, which could be your subdirectory (you may need to escape some characters):
{{sub/directory/\*}}

h3. See also
Please see this [Atlassian Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/257995/is-there-a-way-to-trigger-a-bamboo-build-on-changes-to-a-specific-sub-directory-of-a-git-repository] for more detail and discussion on this workaround.
fields.summary: Allow Stash/Bitbucket Server Repository Trigger to use Subdirectory instead of full Repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Deployment project and environment hierarchy is currently at least, unclear. 
{quote}
Where a user has environment permissions enabled but project permissions disabled, they will still be unable to access a deployment environment.
{quote}
Source: [Permissions for deployment environments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/permissions-for-deployment-environments-342753929.html]

If the user has the *View* permission at the environment level but not at the project level, they cannot access the deployment environment which is consistent with the above documentation.

However if *View* is enabled at the Project level, the 'Edit' permission at the environment level takes precedence over the project *Edit* permission. I.E. If the user has *Edit* on the Environment but not on the Project, they can still *Edit* the environment which is not consistent with the behavior of the *View* permission.

From the Project permission UI:
{quote}
Edit - Controls who can change the details of the project, related plan and *any of the environment configuration.* Users with edit permission can also create versions.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
* Correct the permission precedence to work consistently or
* Amend the documentation to clearly state how it's currently meant to work.
fields.summary: As a Bamboo administrator, the deployment environment and project permission precedence is unclear

fields.description:
When commit isolation is enabled in a SVN linked repository, {{bamboo.planRepository.previousRevision}} is only populated in the first build in the series of build for the list of commits.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Remove the trigger from the plan
# Making multiple commits to the repo
# Re-add the trigger and let Bamboo trigger multiple builds

h5. Expected output
All resulted builds should get the same variables

h5. Actual output
{{bamboo.planRepository.previousRevision}} is only present in the first build in the series
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed}
${bamboo.planRepository.previousRevision}: bad substitution
{noformat}
fields.summary: bamboo.planRepository.previousRevision is only populated in the first build when using commit isolation in SVN

fields.description:
Currently, all the artifacts from build plan are required in Deployment Environment Artifact Download task (with the option "All artifacts").

If there is one artifact not generated in the build plan, the Deployment Environment Artifact Download task will fail.

It would be better if Artifact Download task have the configuration to set build plan artifacts as optional, ideally we could set which artifacts are mandatory and which are optional.
fields.summary: Optional artifacts from build plan

fields.description: Currently, build artifact and release artifact are enabled with a single option. Split the option into 2 checkbox for release and build artifact.
fields.summary: Separate expiry configuration for release and build artifact

fields.description:
During startup of Bamboo and its remote agent, add an additional task to check for supported java version and throw meaningful error messages if an unsupported version is used.

Currently, Bamboo remote agent throws UnsupportedClassVersionError.
fields.summary: Check java version and other supported platforms version during startup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Bamboo 5.9.x and earlier the XML export may take a very long time on the deployment project mapping stage:
{code}
2015-10-11 13:13:50,790 INFO [http-bio-8085-exec-2] [XmlMigrator] Exporting with: com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.projects.migration.stream.DeploymentProjectMapper
{code}

h3. Resolution
Upgrade to Bamboo 5.10 or later to receive the performance improvements made.
fields.summary: XML Export speed of deployment versions stage in Bamboo

fields.description:
Help organize a Bamboo instance with a large number of deployment plans and environments by implementing (at minimum) the organization features of build plans.

Suggestions include:
 * Allow deployment plans to be organized into projects
 * Allow list of deployment plans within a project to be collapsed
 * Allow list of environment within a plan to be collapsed
fields.summary: Visually organize deployment plans to match build plans

fields.description:
Can you make Serenity BDD reports publish in Bamboo?
there is special plugin for Jenkins, can you do similar in Bamboo pls?
fields.summary: Serenity BDD reports publishing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo can now connect to external user repositories, such as Crowd and LDAP, but we do not have a way to sync those repositories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a repository sync feature, similar to the one in other Atlassian products (eg: Bitbucket Server)
 
h3. Workaround
Restart Bamboo to force the sync.
fields.summary: Sync User Repository

fields.summary: Dependencies page is always broken while add child plan that contains long dash "—" in name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Event is not triggered after changing existing user/group permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a build plan
# From the Actions dropdown, select Configure Plan
# Select the Permissions tab
# Update any permissions.
# Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results
{{BuildConfigurationUpdatedEvent}} is triggered.


h3. Actual Results
{{aclService.updateAcl(acl)}} is called in Struts actions without event triggering.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: BuildConfigurationUpdatedEvent is not triggered when plan permissions are changed

fields.description:
The hung build detection scheme uses both elapsed build time *and* time-since-log-update to trigger hung-build detection. It appears that for the 1st build on a branch plan, there is no average build time and hence no ability to detect hung builds.

We observed a failure to detect a hung build when the build did not update the log for over two days.  (The average time for this build on other plan branches was ~6 minutes.  The build hang time multiplier was set to 10x and the log timeout was 150 minutes).

I would suggest that for the 1st build on a branch:

A) Ignore the detection based on average build time and use log-update time only, or

B) Use the average build time from a different branch plan (or the average build time of all branch plans)
fields.summary: Build hang detection does not work on new branches

fields.description:

# Create a deployment environment with Artifact Download task
