fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo does not automatically detect Issues from JIRA branches when the Issue key is not the start of the branch name.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Bamboo to find JIRA issues in branches with Issue Keys in the middle of strings. This will allow for naming conventions used by Feature and Bugfix branches, for example:
* feature/ISSUE-1
* bugfix/ISSUE-2
 
h3. Workaround
Manually create branches whose names start with the Issue key
fields.summary: Bamboo not detecting JIRA issues from branches whose names do not start with the issue key

fields.description:
h3. Request
Add the ability to specify credentials for the Docker Build task. This would allow the build to pull a base image from a Docker registry that requires authentication. This would work like the Docker Push - do a 'docker login' before execution.
fields.summary: Add user credentials to Docker Build task

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some customers have scripts which analyze test failures and link them to existing JIRA issues - particularly useful when 50 test failures are all linked to the same underlying JIRA issue, it is much easier to link them programmatically than manually.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
REST API which will allows you to link test cases to Jira issues.
fields.summary: REST API for linking test cases to JIRA issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If an invalid deployment project id is used in a {{/deploy/project/\{deploymentProjectId\}/version}} call, a NullPointerException is thrown, which is surfaced as a 500 error. This may be confusing to end-users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide user-friendly error output when cause is NullPointerException
fields.summary: Improve Bamboo REST API error messages to be user-friendly

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When using the inject Bamboo variable task, variables can only be placed in script or command task directly and cannot be referenced in build files or plan variables.

h3. Configuration
I added the following variables:
* Plan variable: OctoPackPackageVersion = 1.0.$bamboo_inject_ newbranchID.45
* Inject variable: newbranchID = updated!

In my script task I placed the following:
{noformat}
echo "echo bamboo_inject_newbranchID"
echo $bamboo_inject_newbranchID

echo "echo bamboo_OctoPackPackageVersion"
echo $bamboo_OctoPackPackageVersion

echo "echo 1.0.bamboo_inject_newbranchID.45"
echo 1.0.$bamboo_inject_newbranchID.45
{noformat}

h3. Results
{noformat}
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	echo bamboo_inject_newbranchID
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	updated!
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	echo bamboo_OctoPackPackageVersion
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	1.0.$bamboo_inject_newbranchID.45
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	echo 1.0.bamboo_inject_newbranchID.45
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	1.0.updated!.45
{noformat}

h3. Expected results
{noformat}
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	echo bamboo_inject_newbranchID
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	updated!
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	echo bamboo_OctoPackPackageVersion
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	1.0.updated!.45
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	echo 1.0.bamboo_inject_newbranchID.45
build	27-Sep-2016 12:39:14	1.0.updated!.45
{noformat}

h3. Improvement
Improve inject variable referencing in plan variables and external resources
fields.summary: Improve inject variable referencing in plan variables and external resources

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Bitbucket Cloud Bamboo service can only trigger a single build plan key as configured in the services config. The plan keys configured normally points to the default plan and not the branch plan. When branch plans are created, these plans are not triggered by commits.
h3. Suggested Solution
Enable a similar trigger solution similar to Bitbucket Server where branch plans are supported
h3. Workaround
Use polling for branch plans
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud trigger Branch Plans

fields.description:
Currently, Automatic Branch Management for Bitbucket Server/Stash repository Plan will fallback to polling when Bitbucket Server is offline or in maintenance mode. Of course this means that git commands will fail.
{noformat}
2016-09-20 11:50:26,999 INFO [11-BranchDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-19-thread-1] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Repository error while detecting branches for plan PROJ-PLAN. command /path/to/git.exe ls-remote ssh://xxx@127.0.0.1:53958/project/repo.git failed with code 128. Working directory was [/path/to/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir]., stderr:
Warning: Permanently added '[127.0.0.1]:53958' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
Bitbucket is currently unavailable:
- The system is unavailable while maintenance is being performed.
- Bitbucket is unavailable while it is being backed up
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists. : PROJ-PLAN : command /path/to/git.exe ls-remote ssh://xxx@127.0.0.1:53958/project/repo.git failed with code 128. Working directory was [/path/to/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir]., stderr:
Warning: Permanently added '[127.0.0.1]:53958' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
Bitbucket is currently unavailable:
- The system is unavailable while maintenance is being performed.
- Bitbucket is unavailable while it is being backed up
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{noformat}

Anyway, Bitbucket Server/Stash will send a POST request (trigger) to Bamboo if there is a new/deleted branch.

It would be better for Bamboo to stop performing git ls-remote command in an interval to detect new/deleted branch from Bitbucket Server/Stash and depend only on the POST request (trigger).
fields.summary: Branch detection for Bitbucket Server should not fall back to polling when Bitbucket Server is in maintenance mode

fields.description:

fields.description: It would be nice if we could have a documentation that explains and outlines the steps users need to take to configure parameters and adjust the c3p0 connection pool. Similar to this [HowTo|https://developer.jboss.org/wiki/HowToConfigureTheC3P0ConnectionPool?_sscc=t] KB article. This is very important as our application uses it and users have to modify c3p0 settings more often than not to accommodate their Bamboo instance as they grow large.
fields.summary: Documentation on how to configure the C3P0 connection pool

fields.description: As part of the current [Bamboo Instance Health check|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Instance+Health+check] feature, Bamboo provides a set of tools that can be used to monitor the health of the instance, as well as to identify the root cause when the instance is not performing as expected. However the current health check types only cover the Embedded HSQL database and MySQL. They do not cover Microsoft SQL Server. Please consider expanding this feature to cover Microsoft SQL Server as well.
fields.summary: Expand Bamboo Instance Health check to Microsoft SQL Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing a Remote Agent's recent build activity, in {{Administration >> Agents >> [choose agent] >> View Recent Activity}}, we only show jobs which have "finished" in either success or failure, but no intermediate statuses are shown.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add Stopped/"not built" builds to Recent Activity

h3. Workaround

You can make a call to the REST API [/rest/api/latest/result/\{projectKey}-\{buildKey}|https://docs.atlassian.com/bamboo/REST/5.12.3.1/#d2e239] endpoint, adding the {{includeAllStates}} parameter.
 For example: {{BAMBOO_HOSTNAME/rest/api/latest/result/PLAN-BUILD?includeAllStates}}
 Stopped builds will be appear as {{lifeCycleState="NotBuilt"}} {{<buildState>Unknown</buildState>}}
fields.summary: Stopped Jobs not shown in Agent Recent Activity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the only way to transfer a file in a deployment project is by SCP. SCP is not available on Windows by default.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a "Network Copy" task in Bamboo to transfer file via network protocols like NFS or SMB. Potential parameters could be:
* Target
* Target directory
* Exclude/include file pattern
* Credentials

h3. Workaround
Use a script task to copy the files to network storage
fields.summary: Network Copy task

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Integrating Bamboo with LDAP fails when Bamboo is configured with the external Microsoft SQL Server database.

h3. Environment
* Bamboo 5.13.0.1, 5.13.1
* Microsoft SQL Server 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Configure Bamboo to connect to LDAP through [JIRA|https://www.atlassian.com/try] or [Crowd|https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/download]. Evaluations are free for 30 days
- Switch to another external database.
fields.summary: Integration with LDAP fails when using SQL Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's currently possible to run database altering upgrade tasks with Bamboo 5.13.0.1 on an unsupported database platform. Pre-bootstrap validation task 51111 completes successfully despite detecting the unsupported database version, the upgrade will then proceed to convert all column names to UPPER CASE and fail eventually on the schema upgrade with {{java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'sys.sequences'.}} due to the unsupported database version e.g. MS SQL 2008. 

At this point rollback cannot be achieved without rolling back the database, as the previous versions will be incompatible with the UPPER CASE column names.

h3. Environment
* MS SQL 2008 R2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade a pre Bamboo 5.13.0.1 MS SQL 2008 database to 5.13.0.1

h3. Expected Results
Task 51111 fails and the upgrade fails without altering any database state which will allow rollback to previous version.

h3. Actual Results
Validation task succeeds despite detecting unsupported version:
{code}
2016-09-20 13:07:15,305 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -------------------------------
2016-09-20 13:07:15,305 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 51111 : Verify DB compatibility
2016-09-20 13:07:15,305 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -------------------------------
2016-09-20 13:07:15,344 INFO [-startStop-1] [DatabaseIsSupported] Testing compatibility of [Microsoft SQL Server 10.00.6241] with this version of Bamboo.
2016-09-20 13:07:15,345 ERROR [-startStop-1] [DatabaseIsSupported] Detected MSSQL version 10.0.0, minimal supported version is 11.0.0
2016-09-20 13:07:15,346 ERROR [-startStop-1] [DatabaseIsSupported] Bamboo doesn't support Microsoft SQL Server version 10.00.6241. Please check https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Supported+Platforms for more information.
2016-09-20 13:07:15,346 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] Completed task 51111 successfully.
{code}

Bamboo continues to upgrade tasks and changes the column case:
{code}
2016-09-20 13:07:18,221 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 51301 : Change column names to uppercase on MS SQL
2016-09-20 13:07:18,246 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] --------------------------------------------------
2016-09-20 13:07:18,569 INFO [-startStop-1] [UpgradeTask51301UpperCaseDbColumnNames] Table TRUSTED_KEY not found. Probably migrating from older Bamboo version.
2016-09-20 13:07:18,768 INFO [-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] Completed task 51301 successfully.
{code}

Then fails due to MS SQL 2008 incompatibility during SchemaUpdate
{code}
2016-09-20 13:08:26,105 ERROR [-startStop-1] [SchemaUpdate] HHH000319: Could not get database metadata
java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'sys.sequences'.
{code}

h3. Resolution

If you experience this, the safest path is to rollback your database and Bamboo version to the pre-upgrade backup. To upgrade successfully you will need to use a supported database platform:
* [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Supported+platforms]
fields.summary: Validation task 51111 succeeds despite ERROR with unsupported MSSQL version

fields.description: Some customers would like the ability to add a preference against a job, but not a capability/requirement pair, to flag it to be run only on either a spot or non-spot elastic instance.  If set, it would not consider spot offerings and directly go to a standard instance.
fields.summary: Create a preference for jobs to bypass spot-elastic images when enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When using the Inject Variable Plugin associated with Bamboo these variables cannot be used in the release versioning section of a deployment environment. 

h3. Improvement

Add the variables from the file specified in the Inject Variable task to release versioning section of a deployment environment.
fields.summary: Add variables from Inject Variable Plugin to deployment release versioning page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We currently do not check error output for Build Tasks, but for tasks such as PHPUnit, which can be configured to output to stderr, we won't find the build result.

This can cause false negatives since the "OK" will not be found.

In a Support Ticket, we have the following report from a customer:
{quote}
It is possible to make phpunit output the results on stderr instead of stdout (through configuration `stderr="true"` or the `--stderr` flag).
 Currently, the PHPUnit task expects the string "OK" on stdout in order to determine that the task ran successfully. This is naive because obviously it could also appear on stderr.
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow tasks to search for success markers in stderr as well as stdout.
h3. Workaround

Use stdout instead of stderr.
fields.summary: Allow PHPUnit check for result code on stderr as well as stdout
